content.description: A student combines a solution of <math alttext="N a C l aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> with a solution of <math alttext="A g N O 3 aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>AgNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, and a precipitate forms.
content.question: Which of the following is evidence that ionic bonds formed during the precipitation?

choices.label: The precipitate has a high melting point.
The temperature of the solution did not change significantly during the precipitation.

content.answer: The precipitate has a high melting point.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from experimental data.
